Row.Text: Delicate Arch
One tile impassable natural wonder. Provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to adjacent tiles.
"If Delicate Arch has any significance it lies, I will venture, in the power of the odd and unexpected to startle the senses and surprise the mind out of their ruts of habit."[NEWLINE]–Edward Abbey
Eye of the Sahara
Three tile natural wonder. Provides +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. After the game reaches the Atomic Era it provides an additional +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production and +3 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.
"Oddly, it appears not to be the scar of a meteorite but a deeply eroded dome, with a rainbow-inspired color scheme."[NEWLINE]–Chris Hadfield
Matterhorn

One tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to adjacent tiles. Land combat units who move next to the Matterhorn ignore Hills for the rest of the game and gain +3[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when fighting in hills.

"Let me ask leave, then, to pay a tribute of respect and admiration to the once desired Matterhorn, before his head has lost the last rays of a sun departing to gild loftier and more distant ranges."[NEWLINE]–F. Crauford Grove
Mount Roraima
Four tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides +1 [ICON_FAITH] Faith and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science to adjacent tiles.

"It was a fantastic landscape, for all around were rocks of the weirdest forms standing in apparently impossible positions, some placed on or next to others, in ways that seemed to defy every law of gravity."[NEWLINE]–Goldthwaite’s Geographical Magazine
Ubsunur Hollow
Four tile natural wonder. It appears as Marsh and provides +2 [ICON_FAITH] Faith, +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food, and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production.
"The rising world of waters dark and deep, won from the void and formless infinite."[NEWLINE]–John Milton
Zhangye Danxia

Three tile impassable natural wonder. It appears as a Mountain and provides 2 [ICON_GREATGENERAL] Great General points and 2 [ICON_GREATMERCHANT] Great Merchant points if you own at least one of these tiles.
"With the sun shining brightly, then dusk’s mists falling, at every turn, the scenery changes like magic."[NEWLINE]–Fan Zhongyan
Lake Retba
Two tile natural wonder. It appears as a Lake and provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold, and +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. Does not provide Fresh Water.
"Water, water, everywhere, nor any drop to drink."[NEWLINE]–Samuel Taylor Coleridge, The Ancient Mariner
